Description: Fragment of an ostracon from a pottery vessel that shows different signs on the outside of the vessel, written or rather drawn in black ink as it seems more to be motifs than textual signs. Three lines are distinguishable. The sherd is part of the rim of a plate with a small ledge at the inside, diameter about 25cm, remains of a black substance at the inside. Probably Nile clay, some chaff inclusions and mica, wheel made.
